subject: Writing
title: James Baldwin: Fire and Truth
description: A 60-second lesson on James Baldwin: Fire and Truth.

hook.text: Baldwin left America for Paris to survive as a Black gay man. He came back to fight with words.

buildup.text: His essays and novels dissected race, identity, and the American moral crisis with surgical precision.

discovery.text: The Fire Next Time, published in 1963, warned white America that racial injustice would destroy everyone.

twist.text: Baldwin debated, testified, and wrote while being surveilled by the FBI for his activism.

climax.text: His writing gave language to pain that millions felt but couldn't articulate.

punchline.text: He turned anguish into the clearest prose in America.

quiz.question: What was James Baldwin's influential 1963 essay collection?
options: Go Tell It on the Mountain
